humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a tumor size of 2.6 x 2.2 x 1.6 cm for the central mass of infiltrating ductal carcinoma. Based on the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient's T stage can be determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, the primary tumor is described as forming multiple (2) masses, with the largest one being 2.6 x 2.2 x 1.6 cm. This meets the criteria for a T2 stage, which is defined as a tumor size of 2.0-5.0 cm. The report also mentions that the tumor does not involve the nipple, overlying skin, or underlying chest wall. There is no information suggesting that the tumor meets the criteria for T3 or T4 stages, so the T stage is T2.
